description.plain: Omar Apollo, born Omar Velasco, is a first generation Mexican-American singer/songwriter from Hobart, Indiana. Apollo comes from his middle name, Apolonio. He played guitar in church when he was young, but quit because he didn’t like the music they played. When he was 11 or 12 his parents bought him a guitar for his birthday, but it was an electric guitar and there was no amp. He traded this in for an acoustic guitar at a pawn shop that he eventually learned to play on YouTube. A newer guitar he’d bought later on, got stolen when he was 15 and it took him a couple years to get a new one and get back into playing. He then also learned how to sing on YouTube, after receiving criticism on his voice from his dad and friends. Omar attended Indiana University Northwest, but dropped out two weeks in because he felt like he was supposed to be doing something else and wanted to focus on music. He makes psychedelic indie pop/r&b/jazz.

body.plain: Omar Apollo, born Omar Velasco, is a first generation Mexican-American singer/songwriter from Hobart, Indiana. Apollo comes from his middle name, Apolonio. He played guitar in church when he was young, but quit because he didn’t like the music they played. When he was 11 or 12 his parents bought him a guitar for his birthday, but it was an electric guitar and there was no amp. He traded this in for an acoustic guitar at a pawn shop that he eventually learned to play on YouTube. A newer guitar he’d bought later on, got stolen when he was 15 and it took him a couple years to get a new one and get back into playing. He then also learned how to sing on YouTube, after receiving criticism on his voice from his dad and friends. Omar attended Indiana University Northwest, but dropped out two weeks in because he felt like he was supposed to be doing something else and wanted to focus on music. He makes psychedelic indie pop/r&b/jazz.

songs.title: Ugotme

description.plain: Here, Omar Apollo reflects on a relationship with a female in which love was unreciprocated. Apollo attempts to convince himself that he is “barely in love” to assist in coping with his heartbreak. The second verse essentially details his true feelings for her, revealing his admiration of her and desire to be with her.

songs.embed_content: Read “Ugotme” by Omar Apollo on Genius

songs.full_title: Evergreen (You Didn't Deserve Me At All) by Omar Apollo
songs.title: Evergreen (You Didn’t Deserve Me At All)
songs.title_with_featured: Evergreen (You Didn't Deserve Me At All)

description.plain:
Omar Apollo digs deep into his emotions after a break-up, showing anger, anguish, self-loathing and doubt, but over the course of the track, those feelings of sadness become realization and confidence in his self-worth.

The song is part of Omar’s debut album, Ivory and after going viral on TikTok, the track became the eight single for the record. It became his first radio single and his first charting entry on Billboard Hot 100.

songs.title: Erase

description.plain:
“Erase” finds Omar Apollo stuck on his ex-lover. The song is about trying to get over a past relationship and the lingering post-break up feelings.

In their review of the track, Pitchfork wrote:

Despite his lingering angst, though, Apollo’s tone is more grateful than grieving. “I still think about the time/The time I spent just trying to grow with you."
